snippet: A powerful explosive ripped through the women’s waiting area of a bus stop in Jamrud town, close to Peshawar, on Monday, leaving women and children among the dead.
abstract: Powerful car bomb explodes near government offices in town in northwestern tribal belt of Pakistan, killing at least 17 people and wounding dozens; attack follows Taliban assault on nearby international airport that left 15 people dead, underlining continued potency of Islamist fighters in area.

byline.original: By DECLAN WALSH and IHSANULLAH TIPU MEHSUD

lead_paragraph: A powerful explosive ripped through the women’s waiting area of a bus stop in Jamrud town, close to Peshawar, on Monday, leaving women and children among the dead.

headline.seo: Car Bomb Kills at Least 17 in Pakistani Tribal Region
headline.main: Car Bomb Kills 17 in Pakistani Tribal Region
headline.print_headline: Car Bomb Kills 17 in Pakistani Tribal Region
